title: Standalone dark-theme single-file apology page with 5-step flow and evasive No button

requirements.summary: Add a standalone single-file apology page (inline CSS/JS) with a 5-page flow navigated by a Next button.
acceptanceCriteria: A new file `frontend/public/apology.html` exists and renders without relying on the React app bundle.
All styling is inside a `<style>` tag in the same HTML file and all behavior is inside a `<script>` tag in the same HTML file.
A "Next" button advances sequentially through Page 1 → Page 2 → Page 3 → Page 4 → Page 5.
The layout is responsive and usable on mobile screens.

file_operations.description: Create a fully standalone HTML document that includes all CSS in a single inline <style> and all behavior in a single inline <script>; implement an internal 5-step view/state system with a Next button to advance sequentially and responsive layout rules for mobile.

requirements.summary: Apply the requested dark minimalist design system and Google Fonts (Poppins + Dancing Script) within the standalone file.
acceptanceCriteria: `apology.html` imports `Poppins` and `Dancing Script` from Google Fonts.
Body text uses `Poppins`; header/romantic text uses `Dancing Script`.
The page background color is `#0a0a0a` (or a visually equivalent dark theme anchored on `#0a0a0a`).
Primary text appears white, with rose-pink used as an accent color consistently.

file_operations.description: Add Google Fonts links for Poppins and Dancing Script in the <head>, set global typography (body uses Poppins; romantic headers use Dancing Script), and implement a dark theme anchored on #0a0a0a with white text and consistent rose-pink accents (buttons, borders, glows, highlights) using inline CSS.

requirements.summary: Implement the exact 5-page copy/structure (including glassmorphism on Page 3 and image section on Page 5).
acceptanceCriteria: Each page shows the specified text exactly as provided (including emoji).
Page 3 contains a visually distinct glassmorphism-style card with a soft border and readable apology note text.
Page 4 displays the question and both Yes/No buttons.
Page 5 displays the final text and an image element below it.

file_operations.description: Implement the exact page texts and layout structure for Pages 1–5 (including emoji), ensure Page 3 has a dedicated glassmorphism card container with a soft border and readable apology note, ensure Page 4 shows the question plus Yes/No buttons, and ensure Page 5 shows the final text with an image element below it.

requirements.summary: Add the Page 4 forgiveness mini-game: static glowing Yes and an evasive No button that stays on-screen and can’t be successfully clicked.
acceptanceCriteria: The Yes button does not move and has a clear glow effect.
The No button relocates when a pointer/mouse gets near it and also responds to touch/pointer movement on mobile.
The No button never renders partially or fully off-screen after moving (verified by clamping within viewport bounds using measured button dimensions).
Click/tap attempts on the No button do not successfully trigger a 'No' action; instead they cause the button to move again.

file_operations.description: Implement Page 4 interactions in inline JS: keep the Yes button stationary with a visible glow via inline CSS; for the No button, attach pointer/mouse proximity handling and touch/pointer-move handling to relocate it to random positions within a defined safe container; clamp positions using runtime measurements (container + button dimensions) to prevent off-screen placement; intercept click/tap on No to only trigger another move (no 'No' action).

requirements.summary: On Page 5, render the image using the exact placeholder tag and include a rename instruction comment; style with a soft pink glow.
acceptanceCriteria: `apology.html` contains an `` element on the final page.
A nearby HTML comment explicitly instructs the user to rename their image file to `our-pic.jpg`.
The image has a soft pink glow (e.g., via box-shadow/filter) and is styled to look polished on mobile and desktop.

file_operations.description: On Page 5, include the exact tag `` and add a nearby HTML comment instructing the user to rename their chosen photo file to `our-pic.jpg`; style the image with a soft pink glow and responsive sizing/presentation suitable for mobile and desktop.
